alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 4:31PM CDT until July 02 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following area, Cook. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Underpasses may be flooded. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 430 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rainfall moving into southern Cook County. Rainfall rates of about 1 inch per hour are moving into areas that had received rainfall earlier today. New street flooding may begin shortly. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... Oak Lawn, Palos Park, Orland Park, Midlothian, Markham, South Holland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
